snippet: A small study shows promise that could lead to clues to encoding memory and treating neurological diseases.
abstract: University of California, Los Angeles, researchers conduct experiment in which they are the first to improve memory by applying direct electrical stimulation to a key area of the brain as it learns its way around a new environment; results of the study are published in The New England Journal of Medicine.
lead_paragraph: A small study shows promise that could lead to clues to encoding memory and treating neurological diseases.

headline.seo: Study Explores Electrical Stimulation to Aid Memory
headline.main: Study Explores Electrical Stimulation as an Aid to Memory
